ygData.subject: Re: [neat] Backpropagation and NEAT
ygData.msgSnippet: Hey Peter, I ve never used it, but Backpropagation Through Time (BPTT) is a general method for applying backprop to recurrent neural networks. Here s a paper

Subject: Re: [neat] Backpropagation and NEAT
X-Yahoo-Group-Post: member; u=183620858; y=EJk-YL1wfU6K9qnEsFF8zG_eBjrr6UYQ7wUwH-wwIsprDp4

Hey Peter,

I've never used it, but Backpropagation Through Time (BPTT) is a
general method for applying backprop to recurrent neural networks.
Here's a paper by Paul Werbos describing how it works:

http://axon.cs.byu.edu/~martinez/classes/678/Papers/Werbos_BPTT.pdf

I'm not aware of any implementations that work in conjunction with
NEAT, though. Others on the list might know more about this technique.
Good luck.

--Derek

On Fri, Mar 7, 2008 at 3:19 AM, petar_chervenski
<petar_chervenski@...> wrote:
>
>
>
>
>
>
> Hello there.
>
>  I am looking for any back-propagation algorithm that can work on
>  networks with arbitrary topology such as these that NEAT evolves. All
>  libraries I found so far either assume layered networks or only feed-
>  forward ones.. I am confused. Is there any source code that might help
>  me? Any back-prop implementation that can work on NEAT networks such
>  that it can easily be integrated. Or maybe some papers on the topic?
>  I appreciate any help from the community.
>
>  Peter
>
>
